alert.note: Alert for Blue Earth; Le Sueur; Waseca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 28 at 12:22AM CDT until July 28 at 1:15AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Le Sueur County in south central Minnesota... Northeastern Blue Earth County in south central Minnesota... Western Waseca County in south central Minnesota... * Until 115 AM CDT. * At 1222 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from St. Peter to Mankato to 6 miles south of North Mankato, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Mankato around 1225 AM CDT. Eagle Lake around 1230 AM CDT. Madison Lake around 1235 AM CDT. St. Clair around 1240 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Janesville, Pemberton, Elysian, Waterville, Waseca and Waldorf. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
